snippet: The Japanese consumer electronics giant expects to return to profit this year, aiming to reduce by half the losses in its television business.
abstract: Sony Corporation posts a record annual loss of 457 billion yen ($5.7 billion) in its fourth straight year of declines as it continues to struggle toward a turnaround.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese consumer electronics giant expects to return to profit this year, aiming to reduce by half the losses in its television business.

headline.main: Sony Striving to Cut Its Way From Record Loss to Profit
headline.print_headline: Sony in a 4th Losing Year, The Worst in Its History
